008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.image;
010
011import java.util.Arrays;
012
013import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
014import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
015import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
016import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
017import ij.process.ShortProcessor;
018import imagingbook.common.color.RgbUtils;
019import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
020import imagingbook.common.image.access.GridIndexer2D;
021import imagingbook.common.image.access.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
022
023/**
024 * This class defines a generic data container for scalar and
025 * vector-valued images, using float-values throughout.
026 * Its primary use is in the {@link GenericFilter} framework. 
027 * 
028 * @author WB
029 * @version 2021/01/14
030 */
031public class PixelPack {
032        
033        /** The default out-of-bounds strategy (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}). */
034        public static final OutOfBoundsStrategy DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy = OutOfBoundsStrategy.NearestBorder;
035
036        private final int depth;
037        private final float[][] data;
038        private final int length;
039        private final GridIndexer2D indexer;
040        
041        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
042        
043        /**
044         * Constructor. Creates a blank (zero-valued) pack of pixel data.
045         * @param width the image width
046         * @param height the image height
047         * @param depth the number of channels (slices)
048         * @param obs the strategy to be used when reading from out-of-bounds coordinates
049         */
050        public PixelPack(int width, int height, int depth, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs) {
051                this.depth = depth;
052                this.length = width * height;
053                this.data = new float[depth][length];
054                this.indexer = GridIndexer2D.create(width, height, obs);
055        }
056        
057        /**
058         * Constructor. Creates a pack of pixel data from the given 
059         * {@link ImageProcessor} object. Uses
060         * {@link #DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy} as the out-of-bounds strategy
061         * (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}).
062         * @param ip the source image
063         */
064        public PixelPack(ImageProcessor ip) {
065                this(ip, DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy);
066        }
067        
068        /**
069         * Constructor. Creates a pack of pixel data from the given 
070         * {@link ImageProcessor} object, using the specified out-of-bounds strategy.
071         * @param ip the source image
072         * @param obs the strategy to be used when reading from out-of-bounds coordinates
073         */
074        public PixelPack(ImageProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs) {
075                this(ip.getWidth(), ip.getHeight(), ip.getNChannels(), obs);
076                copyFromImageProcessor(ip);
077        }
078        
079        /**
080         * Constructor. Duplicates an existing {@link PixelPack} without copying 
081         * the contained pixel data.
082         * @param orig the original {@link PixelPack}
083         */
084        public PixelPack(PixelPack orig) {
085                this(orig, false);
086        }
087        
088        /**
089         * Constructor. Duplicates an existing {@link PixelPack}, optionally copying 
090         * the contained pixel data.
091         * @param orig the original {@link PixelPack}
092         * @param copyData set true to copy pixel data
093         */
094        public PixelPack(PixelPack orig, boolean copyData) {
095                this(orig.getWidth(), orig.getHeight(), orig.getDepth(), orig.indexer.getOutOfBoundsStrategy());
096                if (copyData) {
097                        orig.copyTo(this);
098                }
099        }
100        
101        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
102
103        /**
104         * Returns the pixel data at the specified position as a float-vector.
105         * If the supplied array is non-null, it is filled in and returned,
106         * otherwise a new array is returned.
107         * The length of this array corresponds to the number of slices in this
108         * pixel pack.
109         * The values returned at out-of-bounds positions depends on this
110         * pixel-pack's out-of-bounds strategy.
111         * 
112         * @param u the x-position
113         * @param v the y-position
114         * @param vals a suitable 
115         * @return the array of pixel data
116         */
117        public float[] getVec(int u, int v, float[] vals) {
118                if (vals == null) 
119                        vals = new float[depth];
120                final int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
121                if (i < 0) {    // i = -1 --> default value (zero)
122                        Arrays.fill(vals, 0);
123                }
124                else {  
125                        for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
126                                vals[k] = data[k][i];
127                        }
128                }
129                return vals;
130        }
131        
132        // returns a new pixel array
133        public float[] getVec(int u, int v) {
134                return getVec(u, v, new float[depth]);
135        }
136        
137        /**
138         * Sets the pixel data at the specified pixel position.
139         * The length of the value array corresponds to the number of slices in this
140         * pixel pack.
141         * @param u the x-position
142         * @param v the y-position
143         * @param vals a float vector with the values for this pixel
144         */
145        public void setVec(int u, int v, float ... vals) {
146                final int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
147                if (i >= 0) {
148                        for (int k = 0; k < depth && k < vals.length; k++) {
149                                data[k][i] = vals[k];
150                        }
151                }
152        }
153        
154        /**
155         * Copies the contents of one pixel pack to another.
156         * The involved pixel packs must have the same dimensions.
157         * @param other another pixel pack
158         */
159        public void copyTo(PixelPack other) {
160                if (!this.isCompatibleTo(other)) {
161                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("pixel packs of incompatible size, cannot copy");
162                }
163                for (int k = 0; k < this.depth; k++) {
164                        System.arraycopy(this.data[k], 0, other.data[k], 0, this.length);
165                }
166        }
167        
168        /**
169         * Checks is this pixel pack has the same dimensions as another
170         * pixel pack, i.e., can be copied to it.
171         * @param other the other pixel pack
172         * @return true if both have the same dimensions
173         */
174        public boolean isCompatibleTo(PixelPack other) {
175                if (this.data.length == other.data.length && this.length == other.length) { // TODO: check width/height too
176                        return true;
177                }
178                else
179                        return false;
180        }
181        
182        /**
183         * Checks is this pixel pack has the same dimensions as the
184         * specified {@link ImageProcessor} instance, i.e., can be copied to it.
185         * @param ip the image processor instance
186         * @return true if compatible
187         */
188        public boolean isCompatibleTo(ImageProcessor ip) {
189                if (this.getWidth() != ip.getWidth() || this.getHeight() != ip.getHeight()) {
190                        return false;
191                }
192                if (this.getDepth() != ip.getNChannels()) {
193                        return false;
194                }
195                return true;
196        }
197        
198        /**
199         * Returns a reference to the specified {@link PixelSlice}.
200         * An exception is thrown if the specified slice does not exist.
201         * @param k the slice index (0,...,K-1)
202         * @return a reference to the pixel slice
203         */
204        public PixelSlice getSlice(int k) throws IllegalArgumentException {
205                if (k < 0 || k >= depth) {
206                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("illegal slice number " + k);
207                }
208                return new PixelSlice(k);
209        }
210        
211        /**
212         * Creates and returns a new {@link PixelSlice} with the same dimensions
213         * and out-of-bounds strategy as this {@link PixelPack}.
214         * @return a new pixel slice
215         */
216        public PixelSlice getEmptySlice() {
217                return new PixelSlice();
218        }
219        
220        /**
221         * Returns a reference to this {@link PixelPack}'s internal data
222         * array, which is always two-dimensional:
223         * dimension 1 is the slice index,
224         * dimension 2 is the pixel index (each slice is a 1D array).
225         * @return the pixel pack's data array
226         */
227        public float[][] getArrays() {
228                return data;
229        }
230        
231        /**
232         * Returns the width of the associated image.
233         * @return the image width
234         */
235        public int getWidth() {
236                return this.indexer.getWidth();
237        }
238        
239        /**
240         * Returns the height of the associated image.
241         * @return the image height
242         */
243        public int getHeight() {
244                return this.indexer.getHeight();
245        }
246        
247        /**
248         * Returns the depth (number of slices) of the associated image.
249         * @return the image depth
250         */
251        public int getDepth() {
252                return this.depth;
253        }
254        
255        /**
256         * Returns the out-of-bounds strategy.
257         * @return the out-of-bounds strategy
258         */
259        public OutOfBoundsStrategy getOutOfBoundsStrategy() {
260                return this.indexer.getOutOfBoundsStrategy();
261        }
262
263        /**
264         * Sets all values of this pixel pack to zero.
265         */
266        public void zero() {
267                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
268                        getSlice(k).zero();
269                }
270        }
271        
272        /**
273         * Returns the pixel values in the 3x3 neighborhood around the
274         * specified position.
275         * The returned float-array has the structure {@code [x][y][k]},
276         * with x,y = 0,...,2  and k is the slice index.
277         * 
278         * @param uc the center x-position
279         * @param vc the center x-position
280         * @param nh a float array to be filled in (or null)
281         * @return the neighborhood array
282         */
283        public float[][][] get3x3Neighborhood(int uc, int vc, float[][][] nh) {
284                if (nh == null) 
285                        nh = new float[3][3][depth];
286                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
287                        int u = uc - 1 + i;
288                        for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
289                                int v = vc - 1 + j;
290                                nh[i][j] = getVec(u, v);
291                        }
292                }
293                return nh;
294        }
295        
296        /**
297         * Copies the contents of this pixel pack to the supplied {@link ImageProcessor}
298         * instance, if compatible. Otherwise an exception is thrown.
299         * 
300         * @param ip the target image processor
301         */
302        public void copyToImageProcessor(ImageProcessor ip) {
303                copyToImageProcessor(this, ip);
304        }
305        
306        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
307        
308        /**
309         * Inner class representing a single (scalar-valued) pixel slice of a 
310         * (vector-valued) {@link PixelPack}.
311         *
312         */
313        public class PixelSlice {
314                private final int idx;
315                private final float[] vals;
316                
317                /**
318                 * Constructor. Creates a pixel slice for the specified component.
319                 * @param idx the slice (component) index
320                 */
321                PixelSlice(int idx) {
322                        this.idx = idx;
323                        this.vals = data[idx];
324                }
325                
326                /** Constructor. Creates an empty (zero-valued) pixel slice with the same
327                 * properties as the containing pixel pack but not associated
328                 * with it.
329                 */
330                PixelSlice() {
331                        this.idx = -1;
332                        this.vals = new float[length];
333                }
334                
335                /**
336                 * Returns the pixel value for the specified image position.
337                 * @param u the x-position
338                 * @param v the y-position
339                 * @return the slice value
340                 */
341                public float getVal(int u, int v) {
342                        int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
343                        return (i >= 0) ? vals[i] : 0;
344                }
345                
346                /**
347                 * Sets the pixel value at the specified image position.
348                 * @param u the x-position
349                 * @param v the y-position
350                 * @param val the new value
351                 */
352                public void setVal(int u, int v, float val) {
353                        int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
354                        if (i >= 0) {
355                                vals[i] = val;
356                        }
357                }
358                
359                /**
360                 * Returns the slice index for this pixel slice, i.e, the
361                 * component number in the containing pixel pack.
362                 * -1 is returned if the pixel slice is not associated with
363                 * a pixel pack.
364                 * @return the slice index
365                 */
366                public int getIndex() {
367                        return idx;
368                }
369                
370                /** 
371                 * Returns a reference to the data array associated with this pixel slice.
372                 * @return the data array
373                 */
374                public float[] getArray() {
375                        return vals;
376                }
377                
378                /**
379                 * Returns the length (number of pixels) of the associated 1D pixel array.
380                 * @return the length of the image array
381                 */
382                public int getLength() {
383                        return vals.length;
384                }
385                
386                /**
387                 * Returns the width of the associated image
388                 * (see also {@link GridIndexer2D}).
389                 * @return the image width
390                 */
391                public int getWidth() {
392                        return PixelPack.this.getWidth();
393                }
394                
395                /**
396                 * Returns the height of the associated image
397                 * (see also {@link GridIndexer2D}).
398                 * @return the image height
399                 */
400                public int getHeight() {
401                        return PixelPack.this.getHeight();
402                }
403                
404                /**
405                 * Sets all pixel values to zero.
406                 */
407                public void zero() {
408                        Arrays.fill(this.vals, 0);
409                }
410                
411                /**
412                 * Copies the contents of this pixel slice to another
413                 * pixel slice.
414                 * @param other the pixel slice to modified
415                 */
416                public void copyTo(PixelSlice other) {
417                        System.arraycopy(this.vals, 0, other.vals, 0, this.vals.length);
418                }
419                
420                /**
421                 * Returns the pixel values from the 3x3 neighborhood centered at
422                 * the specified position.
423                 * The 3x3 array {@code nh[x][y]} has the coordinates
424                 * x = 0,..,2 and y = 0,..,2; 
425                 * the value at position {@code [1][1]} belongs to the 
426                 * specified position.
427                 * If a non-null array is supplied, it is filled and returned.
428                 * If null, a new array is created and returned.
429                 * 
430                 * @param uc the center x-position
431                 * @param vc the center y-position
432                 * @param nh a 3x3 array or null
433                 * @return a 3x3 array of pixel values
434                 */
435                public float[][] get3x3Neighborhood(int uc, int vc, float[][] nh) {
436                        if (nh == null) 
437                                nh = new float[3][3];
438                        for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
439                                int u = uc - 1 + i;
440                                for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
441                                        int v = vc - 1 + j;
442                                        nh[i][j] = getVal(u, v);
443                                }
444                        }
445                        return nh;
446                }
447        }
448        
449        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
450
451        /**
452         * Utility method. Copies the contents of an image processor to an existing
453         * pixel pack. They must be compatible w.r.t. size and depth.
454         * 
455         * @param ip the image processor to be copied
456         */
457        public void copyFromImageProcessor(ImageProcessor ip) {
458                if (!isCompatibleTo(ip) ){
459                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("copyFromImageProcessor(): incompatible ImageProcessor/PixelPack)");
460                }
461                if (ip instanceof ByteProcessor)
462                        copyFromByteProcessor((ByteProcessor)ip);
463                else if (ip instanceof ShortProcessor)
464                        copyFromShortProcessor((ShortProcessor)ip);
465                else if (ip instanceof FloatProcessor)
466                        copyFromFloatProcessor((FloatProcessor)ip);
467                else if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor)
468                        copyFromColorProcessor((ColorProcessor)ip);
469                else 
470                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip.getClass().getSimpleName());
471        }
472        
473        private void copyFromByteProcessor(ByteProcessor ip) {
474                byte[] pixels = (byte[]) ip.getPixels();
475                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
476                        data[0][i] = 0xff & pixels[i];
477                }
478        }
479        
480        private void copyFromShortProcessor(ShortProcessor ip) {
481                short[] pixels = (short[]) ip.getPixels();
482                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
483                        data[0][i] = 0xffff & pixels[i];
484                }
485        }
486        
487        private void copyFromFloatProcessor(FloatProcessor ip) {
488                float[] pixels = (float[]) ip.getPixels();
489                System.arraycopy(pixels, 0, data[0], 0, pixels.length);
490        }
491        
492        private void copyFromColorProcessor(ColorProcessor ip) {
493                final int[] pixels = (int[]) ip.getPixels();
494                final int[] rgb = new int[3];
495                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
496                        RgbUtils.intToRgb(pixels[i], rgb);
497                        data[0][i] = rgb[0];
498                        data[1][i] = rgb[1];
499                        data[2][i] = rgb[2];
500                }
501        }
502        
503        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
504        
505        /**
506         * Copies the contents of a pixel pack to an existing
507         * image processor. They must be compatible w.r.t. size and depth.
508         * 
509         * @param pack the source pixel pack
510         * @param ip the receiving image processor
511         */
512        public static void copyToImageProcessor(PixelPack pack, ImageProcessor ip) {
513                if (!pack.isCompatibleTo(ip) ){
514                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("copyToImageProcessor(): incompatible ImageProcessor/PixelPack)");
515                }
516                if (ip instanceof ByteProcessor)
517                        copyToByteProcessor(pack, (ByteProcessor)ip);
518                else if (ip instanceof ShortProcessor)
519                        copyToShortProcessor(pack, (ShortProcessor)ip);
520                else if (ip instanceof FloatProcessor)
521                        copyToFloatProcessor(pack, (FloatProcessor)ip);
522                else if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor)
523                        copyToColorProcessor(pack, (ColorProcessor)ip);
524                else
525                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip.getClass().getSimpleName());
526        }
527        
528        private static void copyToByteProcessor(PixelPack pack, ByteProcessor ip) {
529                byte[] pixels = (byte[]) ip.getPixels();
530                float[] P = pack.data[0];
531                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
532                        int val = clampByte(Math.round(P[i]));
533                        pixels[i] = (byte) val;
534                }
535        }
536        
537        private static void copyToShortProcessor(PixelPack pack, ShortProcessor ip) {
538                short[] pixels = (short[]) ip.getPixels();
539                float[] P = pack.data[0];
540                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
541                        int val = clampShort(Math.round(P[i]));
542                        pixels[i] = (short) val;
543                }
544        }
545        
546        private static void copyToFloatProcessor(PixelPack pack, FloatProcessor ip) {
547                float[] pixels = (float[]) ip.getPixels();
548                float[] P = pack.data[0];
549                System.arraycopy(P, 0, pixels, 0, P.length);
550        }
551        
552        private static void copyToColorProcessor(PixelPack pack, ColorProcessor ip) {
553                int[] pixels = (int[]) ip.getPixels();
554                float[] R = pack.data[0];
555                float[] G = pack.data[1];
556                float[] B = pack.data[2];
557                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
558                        int r = clampByte(Math.round(R[i]));
559                        int g = clampByte(Math.round(G[i]));
560                        int b = clampByte(Math.round(B[i]));
561                        pixels[i] = RgbUtils.rgbToInt(r, g, b);
562                }
563        }
564        
565        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
566        
567        private static int clampByte(int val) {
568                if (val < 0) return 0;
569                if (val > 255) return 255;
570                return val;
571        }
572        
573        private static int clampShort(int val) {
574                if (val < 0) return 0;
575                if (val > 65535) return 65535;
576                return val;
577        }
578
579}
